comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

The monthly/weekly time paradigm feels rather non-intuitive to me. 
A calendar view that allows infinite scrolling through days/weeks/months or even gradually zooming from a day into the year perspective would much better represent the continous nature of time.
This could be visualized by an either horizontal or vertical interface that would allow scrolling through time with different resolutions.
http://madebyevan.com/calendar/ might be a good start although it only features the monthly resolution.
I propose the implementation that through its innovative nature and intuitivity  would distinguish the mozilla calendar from all other widely used products.
